In a small village, there was a peculiar sunflower that never bloomed, despite the care of a kind-hearted girl named Elara. Every morning, she watered it, whispered secrets, and even sang lullabies, hoping to coax it into blooming. The villagers teased her, claiming the sunflower was cursed. One fateful night, a fierce storm raged, uprooting the sunflower. Elara, heartbroken, found it tangled in the roots of a mighty oak. As dawn broke, she noticed tiny, radiant flowers sprouting from the oak, each one a reflection of her love for the sunflower. It turned out the sunflower’s true beauty lay in the oak’s embrace.
